name: ListOrganizationApplications
description:
Lists all applications in the organization with filters.

Use this tool to retrieve a list of all applications within the organization. Supports filtering and pagination to manage large sets of applications efficiently.

parameters.name: search_query
parameters.description: Search for applications with names or labels starting with this value using the `startsWith` operation.

value_schema.description: Searches for apps with `name` or `label` properties that starts with the `q` value using the `startsWith` operation

parameters.name: pagination_cursor
parameters.description: Opaque string to fetch the next page of results. Obtained from the 'next' link.

value_schema.description: Specifies the [pagination](/#pagination) cursor for the next page of results. Treat this as an opaque value obtained through the `next` link relationship.

parameters.name: results_per_page
parameters.description: Specifies the number of results per page for pagination.

value_schema.description: Specifies the number of results per page

parameters.name: filter_expression_for_applications
parameters.description: Filters applications using `status`, `user.id`, `group.id`, `credentials.signing.kid`, or `name` with `eq` operator.

value_schema.description: Filters apps by `status`, `user.id`, `group.id`, `credentials.signing.kid` or `name` expression that supports the `eq` operator

parameters.name: expand_user_resources
parameters.description: Embeds more resources in the response, supports `expand=user/{userId}`. Requires the `user.id eq "{userId}"` filter.

value_schema.description:
An optional parameter used for link expansion to embed more resources in the response.
Only supports `expand=user/{userId}` and must be used with the `user.id eq "{userId}"` filter query for the same user.
Returns the assigned [application user](/openapi/okta-management/management/tag/ApplicationUsers/) in the `_embedded` property.

parameters.name: use_query_optimization
parameters.description: Set to true to use query optimization, returning a subset of app instance properties.

value_schema.description: Specifies whether to use query optimization. If you specify `useOptimization=true` in the request query, the response contains a subset of app instance properties.

parameters.name: include_non_deleted_apps
parameters.description: Include non-active but not deleted apps in the results.

value_schema.description: Specifies whether to include non-active, but not deleted apps in the results

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the okta API.

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: Searches for apps with `name` or `label` properties that starts with the `q` value using the `startsWith` operation

value_schema.description: Searches for apps with `name` or `label` properties that starts with the `q` value using the `startsWith` operation

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: Specifies the [pagination](/#pagination) cursor for the next page of results. Treat this as an opaque value obtained through the `next` link relationship.

value_schema.description: Specifies the [pagination](/#pagination) cursor for the next page of results. Treat this as an opaque value obtained through the `next` link relationship.

parameters.name: useOptimization
parameters.description: Specifies whether to use query optimization. If you specify `useOptimization=true` in the request query, the response contains a subset of app instance properties.

value_schema.description: Specifies whether to use query optimization. If you specify `useOptimization=true` in the request query, the response contains a subset of app instance properties.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Specifies the number of results per page

value_schema.description: Specifies the number of results per page

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Filters apps by `status`, `user.id`, `group.id`, `credentials.signing.kid` or `name` expression that supports the `eq` operator

value_schema.description: Filters apps by `status`, `user.id`, `group.id`, `credentials.signing.kid` or `name` expression that supports the `eq` operator

parameters.name: expand
parameters.description:
An optional parameter used for link expansion to embed more resources in the response.
Only supports `expand=user/{userId}` and must be used with the `user.id eq "{userId}"` filter query for the same user.
Returns the assigned [application user](/openapi/okta-management/management/tag/ApplicationUsers/) in the `_embedded` property.

value_schema.description:
An optional parameter used for link expansion to embed more resources in the response.
Only supports `expand=user/{userId}` and must be used with the `user.id eq "{userId}"` filter query for the same user.
Returns the assigned [application user](/openapi/okta-management/management/tag/ApplicationUsers/) in the `_embedded` property.

parameters.name: includeNonDeleted
parameters.description: Specifies whether to include non-active, but not deleted apps in the results

value_schema.description: Specifies whether to include non-active, but not deleted apps in the results

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
